thread.title: 28 Stunning Pictures From The Golden Years Of Air Travel
thread.title_full: 28 Stunning Pictures From The Golden Years Of Air Travel

author: Gabriel H. Sanchez
title: 28 Stunning Pictures From The Golden Years Of Air Travel

organizations.name: michael ochs archives / getty images passengers
san diego air and space museum archive alan band / keystone / getty images

text:
The interior decorations of a PSA airliner in the late 1960s. ID: 10390279 View this image ›
Ullstein Bild / Getty Images A flight attendant makes a bed aboard a German airliner in 1955.
ID: 10390222 View this image ›
Express / Getty Images Jacqueline Dubut, the first female airline pilot for the French domestic airline Air Inter, sits in the cockpit of her plane in 1967.
ID: 10390540 View this image ›
Leonard Mccombe / Getty Images Three Pan Am pilots check out the scenery while flying over Paris in 1956.
ID: 10390850 View this image ›
Bettmann / Bettmann Archive Three flight attendants who served first lady Jacqueline Kennedy during her flight from Italy to India and Pakistan pose for a photo in Rome’s airport.
ID: 10390236 View this image ›
Mirrorpix / Getty Images Air Canada, in its efforts to attract more passengers, installed a dance floor and music for passengers who wanted to dance at 30,000 feet on their way across the Atlantic in 1972.
ID: 10390194 Svf2 / Getty Images
Getty Images
 Left: A pair of flight attendants from Russia’s Aeroflot airline pose for a photo, 1966. Right: Staff prepare meals in the kitchen aboard an Tu-114 airliner (at the time, the world’s largest), 1959.
ID: 10390859 View this image ›
Yale Joel / The LIFE Picture Collection United Airlines flight attendants participate in an evacuation drill as part of their airline safety training in 1966.
ID: 10390499 View this image ›
New York Daily News Archive / Getty Images Elizabeth Taylor boards a plane at an undisclosed airport for Hollywood in1958.
ID: 10390393 View this image ›
Ullstein Bild / Getty Images French singer Sacha Distel performs with his band mid-flight, 1959.
ID: 10390515 View this image ›
Michael Ochs Archives / Getty Images Passengers enjoy a smoke on a Transocean Air Lines Boeing 377 Stratocruiser in 1955.
ID: 10390833 View this image ›
A. Y. Owen / Getty Images A group of women step off an airplane and onto the tarmac at an undisclosed airport in 1958.
ID: 10390360 View this image ›
Dmitri Kessel / Getty Images An exterior night view of the Pan Am Terminal at Idlewild Airport, later renamed John F. Kennedy Airport, in New York City in 1961 features a series of figures mounted on a glass wall (seen at right), collectively called Zodiac Screen and sculpted by Milton Hebald. Tippetts-Abbett-McCarthy-Stratton designed the terminal in 1957.
ID: 10390331 View this image ›
New York Post Archives / Getty Images People gather inside the TWA Terminal at John F. Kennedy Airport in 1966.
ID: 10390556 View this image ›
San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive A pair of PSA pilots make their way to their cockpit in the late 1960s.
ID: 10390872 San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive
Alan Band / Keystone / Getty Images
 Flight attendants work on Southwest Airlines in the early 1970s.
ID: 10390346 View this image ›
U.S. National Archives A commercial airliner departs from National Airport in Washington, DC, in 1973.
